conclusion: Analyze forces acting on latch D to solve for normal force FN in self-locking state.
Identify forces acting on latch D: spring force Fs, frictional force Ff, normal force FN.
Spring force Fs is given by kx, where x is compression distance.
Frictional force Ff acts along inclined surface of latch D.
Normal force FN acts perpendicular to inclined surface of latch D.
Resolve forces into components parallel and perpendicular to inclined plane.
Parallel component of spring force is Fs_parallel = kx cos(30°) = kx √3/2.
Parallel component of frictional force is Ff_parallel = μ FN cos(30°) = μ FN √3/2.
Net force parallel to inclined plane must be zero in self-locking state.
Equation for self-locking state: kx √3/2 + μ FN √3/2 = 0.
Solve for FN: kx √3/2 = -μ FN √3/2, leading to FN = -kx/μ.
Take absolute value for positive FN: FN = kx/μ.
Magnitude of normal force FN in self-locking state is kx/μ.
